Enterprise Cybersecurity Leadership Academy

Last reviewed: No recent edits available

Page description: Designed for county cybersecurity professionals, this virtual 12-week academy provides a comprehensive framework for securing county systems and infrastructure. NACo High Performance Leadership Academy","https://www.naco.org/page/high-performance-leadership-academy"," The NACo High Performance Leadership Academy is an innovative, fully online 12-week program designed to equip frontline county government professionals with practical leadership skills. NACo Deferred Compensation Program","https://www.naco.org/page/naco-deferred-compensation-program"," For more than 40 years, NACo has partnered with Nationwide Retirement Services to provide the largest supplemental retirement income program for county employees. County Leadership Institute","https://www.naco.org/page/county-leadership-institute"," The County Leadership Institute (CLI) is a rigorous leadership program consisting of three days of in-person instruction and virtual meetings. It enhances the capacity of county officials to lead and implement innovative solutions in today’s complex governing environment. County Leadership Institute

Last reviewed: No recent edits available

Page description: The County Leadership Institute (CLI) is a rigorous leadership program consisting of three days of in-person instruction and virtual meetings. It enhances the capacity of county officials to lead and implement innovative solutions in today’s complex governing environment. Participants engage in intensive, high-level training that prepares them to embrace their leadership role and drive meaningful change in their counties.

Counties for Career Success","https://www.naco.org/program/counties-career-success"," The Counties for Career Success (C4CS) initiative helps counties build local career pathways through cross-sector collaboration. Each year, a selected cohort of counties receives technical assistance, access to national experts, and peer learning opportunities to enhance their efforts in connecting residents to higher education and employment. The program emphasizes equitable access and local innovation in workforce development.","","","","","","","","https://forms.fillout.com/t/sStdjdgUGkus?status=recxMSvxSYS30wIXH&webpage=recFZhsjrsHXNGm2V&staffer=","https://forms.fillout.com/t/sStdjdgUGkus?status=recWaPWnJdyY9sh3y&webpage=recFZhsjrsHXNGm2V&staffer=","recFZhsjrsHXNGm2V","","","","","<div style='padding-top:6px

Counties for Career Success

Last reviewed: No recent edits available

Page description: The Counties for Career Success (C4CS) initiative helps counties build local career pathways through cross-sector collaboration. Each year, a selected cohort of counties receives technical assistance, access to national experts, and peer learning opportunities to enhance their efforts in connecting residents to higher education and employment. The program emphasizes equitable access and local innovation in workforce development.

Public Promise Insurance","https://www.naco.org/page/public-promise-insurance-agency"," Public Promise Insurance (PPI) helps counties attract and retain top talent through a nationally competitive suite of voluntary benefits. Backed by the largest insurance carriers in the country, PPI bridges the compensation gap between public and private sector employment with benefits like pet insurance, legal services, and identity theft protection. Counties for Economic Mobility","https://www.naco.org/program/counties-economic-mobility","Counties for Economic Mobility (C4EM) helps county leaders advance equitable upward economic mobility and move individuals and families out of poverty. Counties for Economic Mobility

Last reviewed: No recent edits available

Page description: Counties for Economic Mobility (C4EM) helps county leaders advance equitable upward economic mobility and move individuals and families out of poverty. Building Resilient Economies in Coal Communities (Past Program)","https://www.naco.org/program/building-resilient-economies-coal-communities"," The Building Resilient Economies in Coal Communities (BRECC) initiative connected coal communities across the nation to support local leaders and build capacity in under-resourced areas. Economic Mobility Leadership Network (Past Program)","https://www.naco.org/program/economic-mobility-leadership-network"," From 2019 to 2023, the Economic Mobility Leadership Network (EMLN) supported county leaders in developing strategies to improve upward economic mobility. It provided cohort-based learning opportunities and tackled interconnected issues such as housing, workforce development, and digital inclusion. This initiative laid the groundwork for future NACo mobility efforts, including the current Counties for Economic Mobility initiative.","","","","","","","","https://forms.fillout.com/t/sStdjdgUGkus?status=recxMSvxSYS30wIXH&webpage=recvkcgsgKX3ILwwz&staffer=","https://forms.fillout.com/t/sStdjdgUGkus?status=recWaPWnJdyY9sh3y&webpage=recvkcgsgKX3ILwwz&staffer=","recvkcgsgKX3ILwwz","","","","","<div style='padding-top:6px

Economic Mobility Leadership Network (Past Program)

Last reviewed: No recent edits available

Page description: From 2019 to 2023, the Economic Mobility Leadership Network (EMLN) supported county leaders in developing strategies to improve upward economic mobility. It provided cohort-based learning opportunities and tackled interconnected issues such as housing, workforce development, and digital inclusion. This initiative laid the groundwork for future NACo mobility efforts, including the current Counties for Economic Mobility initiative.

Stepping Up: A National Initiative to Reduce the Number of People with Mental Illness in Jails (Past Program)","https://www.naco.org/center/stepping"," Launched in 2015, the Stepping Up initiative called on counties to pass resolutions and work across departments to reduce the number of people with mental illnesses in local jails. More than 540 counties participated, utilizing a comprehensive suite of resources — including toolkits, webinars, and an online library — to implement evidence-based strategies that improve outcomes for individuals with mental health needs and reduce incarceration rates.","","","","","","","","https://forms.fillout.com/t/sStdjdgUGkus?status=recxMSvxSYS30wIXH&webpage=recKnWo4CubjfqIGq&staffer=","https://forms.fillout.com/t/sStdjdgUGkus?status=recWaPWnJdyY9sh3y&webpage=recKnWo4CubjfqIGq&staffer=","recKnWo4CubjfqIGq","","","","","<div style='padding-top:6px

Stepping Up: A National Initiative to Reduce the Number of People with Mental Illness in Jails (Past Program)

Last reviewed: No recent edits available

Page description: Launched in 2015, the Stepping Up initiative called on counties to pass resolutions and work across departments to reduce the number of people with mental illnesses in local jails. More than 540 counties participated, utilizing a comprehensive suite of resources — including toolkits, webinars, and an online library — to implement evidence-based strategies that improve outcomes for individuals with mental health needs and reduce incarceration rates.

Familiar Faces Initiative (Past Program)","https://www.naco.org/program/familiar-faces-initiative"," The Familiar Faces Initiative aimed to reduce incarceration and hospitalization rates among individuals who frequently cycle through jails, homeless shelters, emergency rooms, and crisis services. Becoming Energy Ready (SolSmart Program)","https://www.naco.org/program/solsmart"," SolSmart is a national program that helps counties become “solar energy ready” by streamlining processes that make it faster, easier, and more affordable to install solar energy systems. Participating counties receive no-cost technical assistance, peer learning opportunities, and national recognition for their leadership in advancing clean energy. By earning SolSmart designation, counties demonstrate their commitment to energy resilience and economic development.","","","","","","","","https://forms.fillout.com/t/sStdjdgUGkus?status=recxMSvxSYS30wIXH&webpage=recYm2Z8n8uKXx6xc&staffer=","https://forms.fillout.com/t/sStdjdgUGkus?status=recWaPWnJdyY9sh3y&webpage=recYm2Z8n8uKXx6xc&staffer=","recYm2Z8n8uKXx6xc","","","","","<div style='padding-top:6px

Becoming Energy Ready (SolSmart Program)

Last reviewed: No recent edits available

Page description: SolSmart is a national program that helps counties become “solar energy ready” by streamlining processes that make it faster, easier, and more affordable to install solar energy systems. Participating counties receive no-cost technical assistance, peer learning opportunities, and national recognition for their leadership in advancing clean energy. By earning SolSmart designation, counties demonstrate their commitment to energy resilience and economic development.

Operation Green Light for Veterans","https://www.naco.org/program/operation-green-light-veterans"," In 29 states, County Veterans Service Officers (CVSOs) help veterans access over $50 billion annually in VA benefits. Through Operation Green Light, hundreds of counties shine a green light during the week of Veterans Day to show support for veterans and raise awareness about the life-saving services available to them. The initiative is an easy and visible way for counties to demonstrate their gratitude and engage their communities.","","","","","","","","https://forms.fillout.com/t/sStdjdgUGkus?status=recxMSvxSYS30wIXH&webpage=rec5XV4uio95kwYaJ&staffer=","https://forms.fillout.com/t/sStdjdgUGkus?status=recWaPWnJdyY9sh3y&webpage=rec5XV4uio95kwYaJ&staffer=","rec5XV4uio95kwYaJ","","","","","<div style='padding-top:6px

Operation Green Light for Veterans

Last reviewed: No recent edits available

Page description: In 29 states, County Veterans Service Officers (CVSOs) help veterans access over $50 billion annually in VA benefits. Through Operation Green Light, hundreds of counties shine a green light during the week of Veterans Day to show support for veterans and raise awareness about the life-saving services available to them. The initiative is an easy and visible way for counties to demonstrate their gratitude and engage their communities.
